headline: AZ State Senator Wendy Rogers Drops 88 Bills: “We Are Going Back to In-Person One Day One Vote NO MACHINES And Paper Ballots With Watermarks”
sentences:
In order to improve the security of the ballot and election integrity, we need to move from machines to human hand counts.”
To quote American columnist and author William Vaughan, “To err is human, to really foul things up requires a computer.” SB 1348 returns to an election system that every American can understand: hand counting.

https://t.co/8i3gN6YAkU
— Wendy Rogers (@WendyRogersAZ) January 26, 2022
The full forensic audit of Maricopa County’s 2020 election provided sweeping evidence that Arizona’s 2020 election was stolen from President Trump, and the Arizona Attorney General has since opened a criminal investigation.

Tuesday, January 25, 2022
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
In an effort to restore election integrity and to make sure all legal votes in Arizona are counted for, Senator Wendy Rogers (R-6) is introducing legislation that aims to get rid of automated voting machines.

Former Maricopa County Recorder Adrian Fontes, who facilitated the shady, corrupt 2020 election, recently said that “AZ must go 100% ballot by mail.” Rogers responded by calling him a “crook” and telling him her plans for this session.
SB 1348 would prohibit the use of electronic or other tabulating equipment and would require all ballots to be counted by hand for any and every state, county, city or town election.
Furthermore, neither the Secretary of State, the Board of Supervisors, nor any other officer in charge of elections shall allow the use of electronic or other tabulating equipment.
On Monday, this bill passed through the Senate Government Committee with six more new elections laws, including currency-grade ballot counterfraud requirements.
Arizona State Senator Wendy Rogers has already proposed 88 bills for the 2022 legislative session, including legislation to ban machine counting in elections.
We are going back to in person one day one vote no machines and paper ballots with watermarks because of crooks like YOU and Hobbs.
Ballots would be counted by hand only and required to remain segregated by precinct, both before and after counting.
With complicated voting systems comes complicated vulnerabilities that can be difficult to detect.
Senator Rogers tweeted that 70 election integrity bills have been proposed in the Senate so far.
One of these bills, SB1133, will ban a city, town, or school from conducting mail-in elections.
This bill will require elections to be counted by hand and ban electronic tabulating equipment.
“An alarming number of voting machines are vulnerable to hackers,” said Senator Rogers.
On Tuesday, Rogers announced another critical election security bill via press release.
We need to make bold moves to guarantee that every vote is accurately counted.
Arizonans deserve a voting system they can both understand AND trust.
On Monday, Senator Rogers tweeted a link to view 75 proposed laws.
“These systems aren’t reliable and don’t have any credibility.
Even just a dozen votes can make or break a race.
We owe this to the people of Arizona.
Already, that number has grown.
SB 1348 returns us to this.
